pr_title: Issue #7740: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - JavadocStyle

timeline.message: Issue #7740: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - JavadocStyle
Issue #7740: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - JavadocStyle

timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -162,7 +159,7 @@ * * *

- * Also, the filter does not support Javadoc checks: + * Also, the filter does not support suppression inside javadoc reported by Javadoc checks:

timeline.bodyText: It is possible we will have other checks join this list. Please move it to a field.
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: Ok, I'll move it out as a constant next to the definition of INCOMPATIBLE_JAVADOC_CHECK_NAMES
replies.author: wltan

timeline.bodyText: Do we need 2 streams? Does it make sense to combine them and the assignment of the Set?
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: Since the latter stream is being moved to a field, I'll just revert the former stream to Set and work on that as it's closer to the original behavior anyway.
replies.author: wltan

timeline.message: Issue #7740: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - JavadocStyle
Issue #7740: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - JavadocStyle

timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -102,13 +102,20 @@
                     "AtclauseOrder",
                     "JavadocBlockTagLocation",
                     "JavadocParagraph",
+                    "JavadocStyle",
                     "JavadocTagContinuationIndentation",
                     "MissingDeprecated",
                     "NonEmptyAtclauseDescription",
                     "SingleLineJavadoc",
                     "SummaryJavadoc"
     )));
 
+    // Older regex-based checks that are under INCOMPATIBLE_JAVADOC_CHECK_NAMES
+    // but not subclasses of AbstractJavadocCheck.
+    // Will eventually include JavadocMethodCheck and JavadocTypeCheck.

timeline.bodyText: ADDITIONAL does not really explain what this is. How about REGEXP_JAVADOC_CHECKS?
